parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

description: A findings domain for the assessment of disease response to therapy, or clinical classification based on published criteria. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, DOMAIN, C107097, 2021-06-25)

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.definition: A unique identifier for a study.
fields.implementationNotes: Although this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or in the EDC system. This field can be included in the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.
fields.label: Study Identifier
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: STUDYID

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.definition: A unique identifier for a site within a study.
fields.implementationNotes: Paper: This is typically pre-printed in the header of each CRF page for single-site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be pre-printed on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. \n EDC: This should be pre-populated.
fields.label: Study Site Identifier
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: SITEID

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.completionInstructions: Record the identifier for the subject.
fields.definition: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.
fields.implementationNotes: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system-generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTMIG.
fields.label: Subject Identifier for the Study
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: SUBJID

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.definition: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.
fields.implementationNotes: The name of the clinical encounter is typically pre-printed on the CRF or displayed within the EDC for any visit-based data collection, most often in Findings domains. This Visit text description is then available in any EDC data extract for that Findings domain.
fields.label: Visit Name
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: VISIT

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.completionInstructions: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.definition: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).
fields.implementationNotes: If the date the tests were collected can be determined from the visit date variable (VISDAT), apply that date to all of the tests at that visit, or the collection date can be collected on the CRF using the date (RSDAT). In this domain, it may not be appropriate to use the visit date as RSDTC.
fields.label: Visit Date
fields.mappingInstructions: This field is not an SDTM variable. If the date of a measurement, test, observation can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM), concatenate the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populate the SDTMIG variable RSDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: VISDAT
fields.questionText: What [is/was] the date of the visit?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C118971
Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C124298

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

priorVersion.title: Category for Response or Clin Class

rootItem.title: Category for Response or Clin Class

self.title: Category for Response or Clin Class

fields.definition: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.
fields.implementationNotes: This is most commonly either a heading or a pre-printed category value on the CRF, not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response is typically a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included in the column heading. There are separate codelists used for categorizing records about oncology response criteria (ONCRCAT) or other clinical classification (CRSCAT). Collect if multiple clinical classifications, or disease responses are active in a single study/database; otherwise, information should be distinguished somewhere on a form (e.g., table name, title, tab).
fields.label: Category for Response or Clin Class
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: RSCAT
fields.questionText: What is the [category/ criteria] for the [disease response/clinical classification] or What is the [response/clinical classification] criteria?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

priorVersion.title: Subcategory for Response or Clin Class

rootItem.title: Subcategory for Response or Clin Class

self.title: Subcategory for Response or Clin Class

fields.definition: A sub-division of the RSCAT values based on user-defined characteristics.
fields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be pre-printed on the CRF or screen and pre-populated in the data management system. This is not typically a question to which the site would provide an answer. RSSCAT can only be used if there is an RSCAT, and it must be a subcategorization of RSCAT.
fields.label: Subcategory for Response or Clin Class
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: RSSCAT
fields.questionText: What is the subcategory for the [disease response/clinical classification]?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.completionInstructions: Indicate whether or not the [disease response/clinical classification] assessment was performed.
fields.definition: An indication of whether a planned disease response or clinical classification assessment was performed.
fields.implementationNotes: A Not Done checkbox, which indicates the test was "NOT DONE". Typically, there would be 1 check box for each measurement. This field can be useful to confirm that a blank result field is meant to be blank.
fields.label: Response or Clin Class Performed
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to derive a value into the SDTMIG variable RSSTAT. If RSPERF="N", the value of RSSTAT will be "NOT DONE". If RSPERF="Y", RSSTAT should be null. A combination of SDTMIG variables ( e.g., RSCAT and RSSCAT, RSTPT) is used to indicate that multiple tests were not done. In this situation, the SDTMIG variable RSTESTCD would be populated as RSALL and an appropriate test name (RSTEST) provided. See SDTMIG for additional information.
fields.name: RSPERF
fields.questionText: Was the [(disease) response/clinical classification] assessment performed?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

priorVersion.title: Response or Clin Class Reason Not Done

rootItem.title: Response or Clin Class Reason Not Done

self.title: Response or Clin Class Reason Not Done

fields.completionInstructions: If the response was not collected, indicate why.
fields.definition: An explanation of why the data are not available.
fields.implementationNotes: The reason that data are not available may be chosen from a sponsor-defined list (e.g., Not Imaged, Patient Refusal, Site Error) or entered as free text. When RSREASND is used, the SDTMIG variable RSSTAT should also be populated in the SDTM-based dataset.
fields.label: Response or Clin Class Reason Not Done
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: RSREASND
fields.questionText: Why was the [disease response/clinical classification] assessment not performed?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Response or Clin Class Assessment Date

self.title: Response or Clin Class Assessment Date

fields.completionInstructions: Record the date of measurements using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.definition: The date of the Response or Clin Class was performed, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.implementationNotes: The date the measurements were collected can be determined from the visit date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the observations at that visit, or the collection date can be included on the RS CRF using the Date of Collection (RSDAT) field.
fields.label: Response or Clin Class Assessment Date
fields.mappingInstructions: This field does not map directly to an SDTM variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTM variable RSDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: RSDAT
fields.questionText: What was the date the response or clinical classification was performed?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C78735

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.definition: The role of the person who provided the information.
fields.implementationNotes: Used only for results that are subjective (assigned by a person or a group). RSEVAL is expected for oncology response criteria. It can be null when the investigator provides all the data in a study. It should contain no null values when data from 1 or more evaluator are used in a study.
fields.label: Response or Clin Class Evaluator
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: RSEVAL
fields.questionText: What was the role of the person performing the [disease response/clinical classification] assessment?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C96777

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

priorVersion.title: Response or Clin Class Evaluator ID

rootItem.title: Response or Clin Class Evaluator ID

self.title: Response or Clin Class Evaluator ID

fields.completionInstructions: Identify the evaluator providing this evaluation.
fields.definition: Used to distinguish multiple evaluators with the same role.
fields.implementationNotes: When multiple assessors play the role identified in RSEVAL, values of RSEVALID will attribute a row of data to a particular assessor.
fields.label: Response or Clin Class Evaluator ID
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: RSEVALID

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

priorVersion.title: Response or Clin Class Link ID

rootItem.title: Response or Clin Class Link ID

self.title: Response or Clin Class Link ID

fields.completionInstructions: If collected, record the unique [Disease Response or Clinical Classification] Link ID.
fields.definition: An identifier used to link the disease response assessment to the related record in another domain which was used to determine the response result.
fields.implementationNotes: This variable is used to provide a unique code in order to link records across related CRFs (e.g., RS and TR) when appropriate. Sponsors develop their own conventions for populating RSLNKID.
fields.label: Response or Clin Class Link ID
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: RSLNKID
fields.questionText: What was the [Disease Response or Clinical Classification ]Link ID Identifier?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

priorVersion.title: Response or Clin Class Link Group

rootItem.title: Response or Clin Class Link Group

self.title: Response or Clin Class Link Group

fields.completionInstructions: If collected, record the unique [Disease Response or Clinical Classification] Link Group ID.
fields.definition: A grouping identifier used to link the disease response assessment to a group of related record in another domain which was used to determine the response result.
fields.implementationNotes: This variable is used to provide a unique code in order to link a group of records across related CRFs (e.g., RS and TR) when appropriate. Sponsors develop their own conventions for populating RSLNKGRP.
fields.label: Response or Clin Class Link Group
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: RSLNKGRP
fields.questionText: What was the [Disease Response or Clinical Classification] Link Group Identifier?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C96781

implements.title: Name of Measurement, Test, or Exam

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

priorVersion.title: Response or Clin Class Assessment Name

rootItem.title: Response or Clin Class Assessment Name

self.title: Response or Clin Class Assessment Name

fields.completionInstructions: Record the name of the RS test, if not pre-printed on the CRF. If collected on the CRF, the sponsor may provide additional instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.
fields.definition: Descriptive name of the disease response or clinical classification used to obtain the measurement or finding.
fields.implementationNotes: Required to identify which test the result is for. It is recommended that the test names be pre-printed on the CRF rather than collected in a free-text field. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Test" can be included in the column heading.
fields.label: Response or Clin Class Assessment Name
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. The SDTMIG variable RSTESTCD may be determined from the value collected in RSTEST. The SDTMIG variables RSTESTCD and RSTEST are required in the SDTM submission datasets. Use appropriate CDISC Controlled Terminology for the test and test code.
fields.name: RSTEST
fields.questionText: What was the [disease response/clinical classification] test name?

implements.title: Result or Finding in Original Units

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

priorVersion.title: Response or Clin Class Original Result

rootItem.title: Response or Clin Class Original Result

sdtmigDatasetMappingTargets.title: Result or Finding in Original Units

self.title: Response or Clin Class Original Result

fields.definition: Result of the disease response or clinical classification as originally received, collected, or calculated.
fields.implementationNotes: Both quantitative results and interpretive findings or summaries may be recorded here.
fields.label: Response or Clin Class Original Result
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: RSORRES

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C71620

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

priorVersion.title: Response or Clin Class Original Units

rootItem.title: Response or Clin Class Original Units

self.title: Response or Clin Class Original Units

fields.completionInstructions: Record or select the original units in which these data were collected, if not pre-printed on CRF.
fields.definition: The unit of the result as originally received or collected.
fields.implementationNotes: Should be pre-printed on the CRF with the associated test when possible, rather than collected in a free-text field. Should be included if applicable and not available elsewhere.
fields.label: Response or Clin Class Original Units
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: RSORRESU
fields.questionText: What was the [disease response/clinical classification] unit?

label: Disease Response and Clin Classification
name: RS
